publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-6328 Bill Wilson: VAT Hits the Poor—That the Parliament notes the warning issued by Save the Children in Scotland that raising VAT to 20% could mean a £31-a-week bill for the poorest families in Scotland and that the poorest 10% of the population currently spend 14% of their disposable income on VAT, compared with only 5% for the richest, and calls on the UK Government not to raise VAT but to adopt progressive rather than regressive taxation policies and do all in its power to eliminate tax evasion and tax avoidance by the wealthy. Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support
S3M-6328 VAT Hits the Poor (lodged on 18 May 2010) Elaine Smith*, Patrick Harvie*, Bob Doris*, Christine Grahame*, Robin Harper*, Bill Kidd*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Hugh Henry*, Jamie Hepburn*
